data.title: Great place
data.text:
I have to give Pace's an excellent rating. It's got an old fashioned way of doing things and I've been a customer, not of this newer location but the original Pace's Dairy Ann in Bountiful/WX for over 45 years (I'm 52). This newer place in Layton is just like the original and maybe even better if the reviews I'm reading about the original are accurate. I hope they are not.

This place is old fashioned and a bit different, especially if you've never been to a burger place like this before.

data.title: Poor service.  Food was not good at all.  AVOID
data.text: Service is bad especially drive thru is not friendly or pleasant in any way.  Shakes were runny and tasted bad.  Not worth going to at all.

data.title: Thanks for lunch
data.text:
Excellent shakes, good service.
I enjoyed my burger, my husband enjoyed his.
They offer a grilled cheese and made it to order -- not grilled -- to my son's delight. The corn dog went down my daughter without a sound. Fries were excellent. Rings were adequate. We would return.

data.title: Great Local Flavor
data.text: One of the great things about Utah is the large number of local burger establishments.  Pace's is our favorite in Layton.

data.title: Fresh food...no rush
data.text:
Pace has delicious burgers prepared to order. Therefore while this is "fast" food, it really isn't. With that said, their food is worth waiting for, most of the time. On occasion the fries are very undercooked, but gratefully that is rare. 
Pace's is also known for their wonderful ice cream treats. We regularly go here just to get an Oreo shake and a huge vanilla cone. The small cone isn't very small, and it is delicious. As you can imagine weekends are packed. I do not believe they are open on Sundays. 
You can also purchase packages of their flavorful Popsicles.

data.title: Great shakes and onion rings
data.text: I really like the assortment of fresh shakes they have here.  I like the store in Clearfield better than the one in Layton but both are good.  The onion rings and burgers are large a nd they now have a pastrami burger.  Can you say yum?

data.title: Great Value for Corn Dogs, Ice Cream, and Cheeseburgers
data.text: For a Utah-style drive in, Pace's is pretty good. They always have some good specials, with great value corndogs and cheeseburgers. There's nothing super amazing about Pace's, but there's nothing really wrong with them either.

data.title: Good place for Burgers and Fries
data.text: Better than the national brands, good food and service.  Nice and clean.   Made for an enjoyable lunch break on our round trip west to Yellowstone and back to Florida.
